column4: no one on the planet seems to have the same ussue as i recieve, asked every linux person and still no answer... why does ubuntu fail to boot unless hold down return
Did you reconfigure an initcript (shutdown or kill script) ?
nope no reconfiguration
At what stage does it stop initiating the shutdown ? ... whats printed before you have to press enter ?
its not the shutdown, upon bootup it just stops. no hard drive activity or anything
Whats printed before it stops initiating other services then ?
nothing it sometimes comes up with the GUI boot screen, other times just a flashing underscore cursor with when holding return moves down the page
i havent just had this issue with ubuntu though. meego also does the same thing
Aha, Hmm.. Thats a problem. You need to add options to grub.conf for the bootup kernel. ACPI options or Graphics card options
I dont know what meego is, havnt tried it
A very new dist i suppose ?
its that intel nokia thing based on linux. but Windows boots up fine but i have tried reinstalls, updates etc and nothing seems to overcome this issue
Sounds like they have issues with the initscripts taken from Gerard Beekman
See the "function" initscript. Make it not halt at petty errors such as starting a server.
i have tried looking in the logs and there is nothing in there about the boot sequencing
The init scripts have no reason to do logging of any kind as the programs are ok.
ok i'll take a look at the moment im in windows for work but i will try that later
grep -i halt bootscripts_directory
ok so that command would fix it?
It should never halt unless its utmost critical
Hell no, itll show where a possible problem resides
are you on the forum to be able to PM the results of the command?
No, i only entail my mind if i feel it can be of value to both parties
ok well it might be tomorrow (GMT) by the time i get this done been up since 5am working all day
